topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 1.1: Protecting Images

body.p: A virtual machine image is a single file that contains a virtual disk with a bootable operating system installed on it. You can use images to create virtual machine instances within the cloud.
If you want to prevent an image from being deleted, you can make that image protected.

section.title: Protect an image

li.p: Launch the HP Helion OpenStack Horizon Dashboard.
Click the Project dashboard, then the System panel, then the Images link.
In the Images screen, for the image you want to protect, click the arrow icon in the Actions menu and select Edit.
In the Update Image screen, select Protected.

section.p: The image is protected and the Delete Image command is removed from the Edit menu.
